column3: Orange means things are getting done. TxDOT EOC, TxDOT base camp and teams out in the field. #TxDOTUnited #HoustonStrong #Recovery
TxDOT Commissioner Laura Ryan visits @ReadyHarris command @houstontranstar. She visited with @JeffLindner1 of @hcfcd. #Harvey2017
EB is now open.
BU 90U public hearing in Houston at Eden Event Center on 9/5 POSTPONED until further notice: http://bit.ly/2vyndC9
Crews repair sinkhole issue on FM 762 in Fort Bend Co.
Traffic signal cabinets ready to go. These cabinets will replace damaged units.
Crews on FM 3005 at Buccaneer in @GalvCoTX make repairs to get signals operational again.
Update: IH 10 East Frwy at the San Jacinto River. WB may open in the next few hours. EB will take longer to open.
HOU Engineers, Maintenance Staff and construction contractors inspecting emergency repairs on FM 762 in Ft. Bend County.
@MCorreaKHOU Thank you for your kind words.
TxDOT family from all over the state together to support the in #Harvey recovery efforts. They are stationed at the basecamp in Sugarland.
As soon as possible.
http://www.drivetexas.org
See our latest tweet.
Great news. IH 69 Eastex SB at the San Jacinto River all mainlanes open. NB will open soon.
Turtle found refuge by entering the nearby water thanks to our crew members.
Not a state road.
All IH 69/ US 59 bridges over the Brazos in Fort Bend are fine. No plans to close NB/SB mainlanes or frontage. @fbcoem.
Of course.
Houston District Engineer Quincy Allen speaks to @DugBegley with @HoustonChron about roadway updates following #Harvey.
Sorry we are just following up with you. This was not accurate.
US 59/ IH 69 Eastex NB at the San Jacinto River all frontage road lanes now open. Mainlanes remain closed. SB mainlanes/ frontage closed.
Keep going to http://drivetexas.org to http://www.houstontranstar.org for updates.
NO truth to rumor that IH 10 WB heading toward San Antonio will be overcome by high water. Follow us, @TxDOTYoakum and @TxDOTSanAntonio.
Crews have begun resetting concrete barrier along IH 69 Eastex at the San Jacinto River. The hope is to get it open this evening.
We are working on it. It will take time. Could be as early as today. Go to http://drivetexas.org for updates.
Thanks for reaching out to us about the sign on IH 45 at Cypresswood. We have addressed the concern.
.@MichelleMerhar Welcome back. A terrible event can bring great things.
TxDOT and @HCTRA working together to ease the burden on the traveling public as roads recover from #Harvey. #teamwork
This is handled by @hcfcd. We handle state roads.
#Safety1st! THANKS to @TxDOT crews traveling in from around the state to support HOU operations. #OneTxDOT #Harvey
Take it from the source. Thank for always setting things straight @JeffLindner1.
Tolls are waived until further notice.
Check http://www.drivetexas.org and http://www.houstontranstar.org for updates.
Auto Dam set up on IH 10 Katy Frwy WB at Eldridge Pkwy to protect road from water inundation due to controlled releases.
We think so. But pls check with @HCFCD
Thanks to @CongCulberson for stopping by to visit the TxDOT Houston EOC.
Be careful and drive safely.
http://Drivetexas.org and http://www.houstontranstar.org
Water is down on MANY of our highways BUT we are not back to normal. #Drive2Conditions #slowdown & #AvoidDistractions
Check with @HCTRA for their roads but tolls waived on TxDOT toll road in Houston (SH 99).
Current conditions on FM 723 at the Brazos River in Fort Bend County.
Refer to http://www.houstontranstar.org and http://www.drivetexas.org.
We are still checking roads. Websites are best options as we are updating them.
Sweeny residents are urged to not go back home at this time.
The @NWSHouston is predicting the San Benard to rise another 5 ft before it crest in Sweeny, Tx. http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/hydrograph.php?gage=swyt2&wfo=hgx.
Pls check http://drivetexas.org and http://www.houstontranstar.org for updates.

Crews at our W. Harris office get ready to head out this morning to begin clearing roads and other work that needs to be done on our roads.
Many are asking about possible routes and what roads are open. Chk http://www.houstontranstar.org and http://drivetexas.org for this info.
Try checking http://drivetexas.org for updates or http://www.houstontranstar.org
Check http://drivetexas.org
You can call 713-802-5000.
We are working to update them. You can check Freeway conditions by viewing the camera snapshots at http://www.houstontranstar.org.
FM 2978 at Spring Creek is blocked. Some news reports have gone out that it was open. It is not safe for passage.
SH 225 WB before Red Bluff SE Harris maintenance crew members D. Whitehead and J. Yanes barricading frontage road.
Current condition of US 90-A bridge at San Bernard River in Fort Bend County.
Rumors help no one. Go to sources like us and @ReadyHarris @BrazoriaCounty @galvcountyoem @fbcoem @MCOEM for key info.
We set up barrels and barricade for a reason. Do not drive around them. #StaySafe
Pls refer to http://www.houstontranstar.org and http://drivetexas.org.
http://DriveTexas.org or http://www.houstontranstar.org
Also go to http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/cctv/transtar/ to check camera views to see road conditions. But it is best to stay put until roads drain.
Stay informed. Go to http://www.houstontranstar.org and http://drivetexas.org for current road closures.
Use http://houstontranstar.org and http://drivetexas.org and maybe use Google maps as well. This is a fluid situation.

They just have to drain off. It depends on the volume of water and how quickly the drainage system can move the water.
TxDOT SE Harris crews clear inlet drains of debris to improve drainage on the highway.
Stay off the road is best idea.
Thanks @SenTedCruz for stopping by to visit the TxDOT Houston District EOC.
Not recommended. Most major roads flooded.
Best thing at this time is stay off the road.
Stay off the road.
IH 10 near Monmouth.
SH 146 at Fred Hartman Bridge in both directions has been closed due to chemical leak from plant nearby.
Crews from our SE Harris office help set up barricade to keep motorist from heading into high water. Help us by staying off the roads.
We are getting multiple inquiries on current road closures. Go to http://www.houstontranstar.org or http://drivetexas.org for updates.
Please allow available road capacity to be used by 1st responders and those trying to provide aid, supplies and resources to our area.
Travel for many is not necessary. Pls stay off the road. If on the road DO NOT go the opposite direction. This is extremely dangerous.
Our teams continue to check road conditions. These were just taken. #Harvey #houstonflood
Go to http://houstontranstar.org or http://drivetexas.org.

All TxDOT sections are putting their best forward to help the community. This is just one fine example.
You will have to check http://houstontranstar.org
Stay off the roads. Most major freeways are similar to what is going on now at I-10 Eastbound and Westbound Greens Bayou just after Uvalde.
Go to http://houstontranstar.org.
Thank you.
TxDOT Galveston Area office staff assist with evacuations on IH 45 at FM 517.
TxDOT Officials Urge Motorists to Stay Off Roads - https://www.txdot.gov/inside-txdot/media-center/local-news/houston/023-2017.html.
Important info you need: high water locations on state roads http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/roadclosures/#highwater. @hcfcd gauges https://www.harriscountyfws.org/?View=full.
We have crews working in all parts of the district. Crews from our Fort Bend office doing a great job on IH 69 at Reading Rd.
This is NEVER a good idea. Don't drive into high waters. Please don't risk it! #BeSafe #TurnAroundDontDrown #Harvey
The roadway network is inundated w/water and not safe for travel. Please stay off the roads today. #Harvey #BeSafe
We are seeing too many people going the opposite direction on freeways. Such drivers are making an already serious situation much worse.
Do not attempt to get on the road. It is not safe. Not only are major freeways and highways impacted but many city roads.
All tolls for SH 99/ Grand Parkway will be waived due to significant flooding until further notice.
Tell him to find a safe spot and stay put.
DO NOT DRIVE THE WRONG WAY ON THE FREEWAY. We are working with our law enforcement partners to get folks off freeways safely.
Please folks do not make an already dangerous situation worse.
Please folks shelter in place. Do not get on the roads. It is a very dangerous situation. This is not a joke.
Over 70 locations with high water. Go to http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/roadclosures/#highwater for updates.
HOU District Engineer Quincy Allen joins @EdEmmett @SylvesterTurner and @ArtAcevedo for press conference to urge people to stay off roads.
SH 288 NB/ SB between MacGregor and IH 610 all mainlanes blocked due to high water.
TxDOT and @HCTRA closing down underpasses on IH 610 W. Loop NB and SB at the Westpark Tollway. Avoid the area.
High water list keeps building. Stay off the roads folks. Get full list of high water locations on state roads at http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/roadclosures/#highwater.
A large band from #Harvey impacting the greater Houston area now. Not a good idea to be on the road. Lots of high water locations.
US 290 EB at Kickapoo all mainlanes blocked due to high water.
IH 69 SW Frwy in both directions near FM 762 and SH 99 all mainlanes and frontage road lanes blocked. Avoid area. Stay away from high water.
IH 69 SW Frwy SB at FM 762 in Fort Bend County all mainlanes blocked due to high water.
TxDOT HOU District signal crews make repairs in various areas to get signals up and running. #heretoserve
High water on SH 87/ Broadway in @CityofGalveston. Find this and other high water locations at http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/roadclosures/#highwater.
TxDOT crews place barrels and barricade on IH 45 ramp just before Galveston Island due to high water on frontage road. #TURNAROUNDDONTDROWN
Big thanks to @TxDOTBeaumont crews for helping clear SH 87 on Bolivar. You are the best! #teamwork
Multiple signals are out throughout the district. Treat these intersections as four-way stops. #staysafe #harvey
Yes.
Pls understand... Avoid high water. You not only endanger your life but others including 1st responders. Already seeing cars in water.
Thank you Congressman @CongCulberson for the great advice. https://twitter.com/congculberson/status/901438524796411904

Very good advice. As heavy rain bands come in road conditions can change quickly.
Our good friends with @FBCSO tell us there is some high water issues at IH 69/ US 59 at FM 762, FM 2218 and at Williams Way.
Our Emergency Operations Center and our staff on @houstontranstar floor monitoring road conditions. Stay off the roads if possible w/ rain.
SH 249 SB before Perry all mainlanes blocked due to possible-fatal accident. Expect delays.
8 high water locations in the Houston District (state roads). Get updates at http://traffic.houstontranstar.org/roadclosures/#highwater.
Great advice.
We stand with our partner agencies to serve the citizens of the greater Houston area.
Top decision makers for the Houston area together - HOU District DE Quincy Allen @TxDPS Region 2 Major Sibley and @METROHouston CEO Lambert.

TxDOT crews in Brazoria County prepare sand bags and recheck equipment as they prep for #Harvey
Thanks @SRobertsKRON4. We appreciate it. We hope people listen and not behave badly when it comes to high water.
Houston District crews out in force and getting equipment ready as #Harvey moves closer to the Texas Coast.
You are welcome. Always here to serve.
Crews stage barrels and signage along SH 87 near SH 124 on the Bolivar Peninsula in prep for #Harvey.
Our Emergency Operations Center on conference call with @NWSHouston and Houston District staff and crews this AM.
Thanks @cobychase!

#Knowbeforeyougo this morning. Get all the info you need including road incidents and construction closures at http://www.houstontranstar.org/.
Crews making progress on removal of sign bridge and overturned heavy truck on IH 610 E. Loop NB at Market. All mainlanes still closed.
